title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a crucial insurance goal for the Bruins, securing a 5-3 win against the Maple Leafs.
Minten was traded from Toronto to Boston last season, and this was his first game back in Toronto.
Minten, praised by coach Marco Sturm, aims to build on his performance and solidify his role with the Bruins.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara received his Hockey Hall of Fame ring and plaque during the induction festivities in Toronto.
Chara was inducted alongside Joe Thornton, both part of the Hockey Hall of Fame class of 2025.
Chara, a Stanley Cup champion and former Bruins captain, was a seven-time All-Star and Norris Trophy winner.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Boston Red Sox are expected to actively pursue top MLB free agents with $219 million already committed in payroll.
Insiders predict the Red Sox may re-sign Alex Bregman; projections suggest a six-year, $160-$171 million contract.
The Red Sox are also linked to free agents Kyle Schwarber, Pete Alonso, Munetaka Murakami, Dylan Cease, and Framber Valdez.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, marking 20 years since his debut.
The concert featured most songs from Legend's debut album 'Get Lifted', mixed with covers and other hits.
Legend's performance included musical medleys and personal stories, showcasing his versatility and accomplished career.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, hinting referees impacted his performance.
Brown recently had a heated response to officiating in a loss to the Jazz, accusing referees of making crucial errors.
Despite his comments, the league acknowledged a missed foul call in the Celtics' loss to the Jazz without fining Brown.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Buccaneers enter Sunday's game against the Patriots with a 6-2 record, leading their division.
Baker Mayfield leads with 1,919 yards, 13 touchdowns, achieving a 98.1 passer rating despite injuries to receivers.
Buccaneers' defense ranks seventh in defensive DVOA, showcasing strong performances by Jamel Dean and Antoine Winfield Jr.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game for CBS, the first Patriots game they've covered since 2023.
Patriots' renewed relevance under quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel draws top CBS announcers for Sunday's game.
Nantz noted a schedule change from the initially planned Bills-Dolphins game to the Patriots game due to Miami's poor performance.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost 123-110 to the Orlando Magic despite Jaylen Brown scoring 32 points.
Celtics' centers and defense struggled, conceding 38 and 39 points in the first and fourth quarters.
Payton Pritchard improved his 3-point shooting, scoring 27 points, but Celtics still need consistent perimeter success.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for a public reprimand for creating an 'appearance of impropriety' during a 2018 incident.
A report found Joseph unaware of a plan to help an immigrant evade ICE but unintentionally created bias perceptions.
Federal charges against Joseph for obstruction of justice were dropped in 2022 in exchange for state investigation cooperation.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future despite playoff elimination by the Yankees last month.
Shortstop Trevor Story opted in, while third baseman Alex Bregman opted out of his contract with the Red Sox.
Boston finished third in their division with an 89-73 record, gaining valuable postseason experience for many players.
